result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary S Speagle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IF REVOKED: 12 days credit as to Count 1 only.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
05/23/19 SENTENCE CREDIT OF 12 DAYS WERE GRANTED CONCURRENT WITH ALL COUNTS.
Concurrent with: each other counts,  but consecutive to any other sentence
Probation/Jail sentence can be transferred to Milwaukee County. NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any
treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Attend Criminal Thinking course.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
